00025 #ifndef SEQUENTIAL_CLF_FILE_H
00026 #define SEQUENTIAL_CLF_FILE_H
00027 
00028 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00029 //
00030 #include "util/Convert.h"
00031 //
00032 #include <cassert>
00033 //
00034 
00039 class SequentialClfFile
00040 {
00041 public:
00045   SequentialClfFile (void)
00046     : m_Rows (0), m_Cols (0)
00047   {}
00048 
00055   bool isSequential (affx::TsvFile& clfTsv)
00056   {
00057     std::string rowsValue, colsValue, sequentialValue;
00058     clfTsv.headersFindNext ("rows", rowsValue);
00059     clfTsv.headersFindNext ("cols", colsValue);
00060     clfTsv.headersFindNext ("sequential", sequentialValue);
00061     // Require rows, cols, and a sequential value of 1.
00062     if (rowsValue.empty() || colsValue.empty() || sequentialValue != "1")
00063       return false;
00064     // Save rows, cols.
00065     m_Rows = Convert::toInt (rowsValue);
00066     m_Cols = Convert::toInt (colsValue);
00067     return true;
00068   }
00069 
00077   void getProbeCoordinates (const int probeId, int& x, int& y)
00078   {
00079     // Probe id is one based, x and y are zero based.
00080     const int id = probeId - 1;
00081     x = id % m_Rows;
00082     assert (m_Cols > 0);
00083     y = id / m_Cols;
00084   }
00085 
00086 private:
00088   unsigned int m_Rows;
00090   unsigned int m_Cols;
00091 };
00092 
00093 #endif /* SEQUENTIAL_CLF_FILE_H */
